questions.question: What are heavenly bodies?
questions.answer: Heavenly bodies are natural objects like the Sun, Moon, stars and planets.

questions.question: Why do stars twinkle?
questions.answer: Stars twinkle due to changes in Earth’s atmosphere.

questions.question: Why is the Sun called a star?
questions.answer: The Sun has its own light and heat.

questions.question: Why are stars not visible during the day?
questions.answer: Bright sunlight hides the stars during daytime.

questions.question: What is a planet?
questions.answer: A planet is a body that revolves around a star and has no light of its own.

questions.question: Name the eight planets of the solar system.
questions.answer: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune.

questions.question: Which planet do we live on?
questions.answer: We live on the planet Earth.

questions.question: What is the solar system?
questions.answer: The solar system consists of the Sun and all bodies revolving around it.

questions.question: What is an orbit?
questions.answer: An orbit is the fixed path of a planet around the Sun.

questions.question: What is a satellite?
questions.answer: A satellite is a body that revolves around a planet.

questions.question: Why is the Moon called Earth’s satellite?
questions.answer: The Moon revolves around the Earth.

questions.question: Does the Moon have its own light?
questions.answer: No, the Moon reflects sunlight.

questions.question: What are asteroids?
questions.answer: Asteroids are small rocky bodies revolving around the Sun.

questions.question: Where is the asteroid belt located?
questions.answer: It is located between Mars and Jupiter.

questions.question: What is a dwarf planet?
questions.answer: A dwarf planet is smaller than a regular planet.

questions.question: Why is Pluto called a dwarf planet?
questions.answer: Pluto does not clear its orbit around the Sun.

questions.question: What is gravity?
questions.answer: Gravity is the force that pulls objects towards Earth.

questions.question: Why do objects fall towards Earth?
questions.answer: Objects fall due to Earth’s gravitational force.

questions.question: What keeps planets in their orbits?
questions.answer: The Sun’s gravity keeps planets in their orbits.

questions.question: What is space?
questions.answer: Space is the region beyond Earth’s atmosphere.

questions.question: Why is space dark?
questions.answer: Space has no atmosphere to scatter light.

questions.question: What is rocket technology?
questions.answer: Rocket technology is used to send objects into space.

questions.question: Why are rockets needed for space travel?
questions.answer: Rockets help overcome Earth’s gravity.

questions.question: What is a spacecraft?
questions.answer: A spacecraft is a vehicle designed for space travel.

questions.question: Who are astronauts?
questions.answer: Astronauts are people trained to travel into space.

questions.question: Why do astronauts wear space suits?
questions.answer: Space suits provide oxygen and protection.

questions.question: Why do astronauts float in space?
questions.answer: They float due to very weak gravity.

questions.question: What is zero gravity?
questions.answer: Zero gravity means extremely weak gravitational force.

questions.question: What are man-made satellites?
questions.answer: Man-made satellites are launched by humans.

questions.question: Give one use of satellites.
questions.answer: Satellites are used for communication.

questions.question: How do satellites help in weather forecasting?
questions.answer: They provide information about clouds and storms.

questions.question: What is Chandrayaan?
questions.answer: Chandrayaan was India’s mission to study the Moon.

questions.question: What was the aim of Chandrayaan?
questions.answer: It aimed to study the Moon’s surface.

questions.question: What is Mangalyaan?
questions.answer: Mangalyaan was India’s mission to Mars.

questions.question: What is Mangalyaan also called?
questions.answer: It is called the Mars Orbiter Mission.

questions.question: What is ISRO?
questions.answer: ISRO is India’s space research organisation.

questions.question: Who was Rakesh Sharma?
questions.answer: He was the first Indian to travel into space.

questions.question: Why is Earth suitable for life?
questions.answer: Earth has air, water and suitable temperature.

questions.question: Why is Earth called a living planet?
questions.answer: Earth supports many forms of life.

questions.question: Why is Earth called the Blue Planet?
questions.answer: Earth appears blue due to abundant water.

questions.question: Which planet is called the Red Planet?
questions.answer: Mars is called the Red Planet.

questions.question: Why is Mars red in colour?
questions.answer: Mars has iron oxide on its surface.

questions.question: Which planet is closest to the Sun?
questions.answer: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun.

questions.question: Which planet is farthest from the Sun?
questions.answer: Neptune is the farthest planet from the Sun.

questions.question: Which planet is the largest?
questions.answer: Jupiter is the largest planet.

questions.question: Which planet is the smallest?
questions.answer: Mercury is the smallest planet.

questions.question: Which planet has rings?
questions.answer: Saturn has a prominent ring system.

questions.question: Which planet has the most moons?
questions.answer: Jupiter has the most moons.

questions.question: Which planet has no natural satellite?
questions.answer: Venus has no natural satellite.

questions.question: Which planet is Earth’s twin?
questions.answer: Venus is called Earth’s twin.

questions.question: Which planet is the hottest?
questions.answer: Venus is the hottest planet.

questions.question: Why is Venus hotter than Mercury?
questions.answer: Venus has a thick atmosphere that traps heat.

questions.question: Which planet rotates very slowly?
questions.answer: Venus rotates very slowly.

questions.question: Which planet rotates from east to west?
questions.answer: Venus rotates from east to west.

questions.question: Which planet has strong storms?
questions.answer: Jupiter has strong storms.

questions.question: Which planet has ice caps?
questions.answer: Mars has polar ice caps.

questions.question: What causes day and night?
questions.answer: Earth’s rotation causes day and night.

questions.question: What causes seasons on Earth?
questions.answer: Earth’s revolution around the Sun causes seasons.

questions.question: How does the Moon move around Earth?
questions.answer: The Moon revolves around the Earth.

questions.question: Why can we see only one side of the Moon?
questions.answer: The Moon rotates once during one revolution.

questions.question: Why is the Moon lifeless?
questions.answer: The Moon has no air or water.

questions.question: What protects Earth from meteoroids?
questions.answer: Earth’s atmosphere burns meteoroids.

questions.question: What is space debris?
questions.answer: Space debris is waste material orbiting Earth.

questions.question: Why is space debris dangerous?
questions.answer: It can damage satellites and spacecraft.

questions.question: What is a space probe?
questions.answer: A space probe is an unmanned spacecraft.

questions.question: What is an unmanned mission?
questions.answer: It is a mission without astronauts.

questions.question: Why is space exploration important?
questions.answer: It helps us gain scientific knowledge.

questions.question: What gives heat and light to Earth?
questions.answer: The Sun provides heat and light.

questions.question: What is solar energy?
questions.answer: Solar energy is energy obtained from the Sun.

questions.question: Why is the Sun important for life?
questions.answer: It provides energy needed for life.

questions.question: What is the centre of the solar system?
questions.answer: The Sun is the centre of the solar system.

questions.question: Why do planets not collide with each other?
questions.answer: They move in fixed orbits.

questions.question: What keeps satellites in space?
questions.answer: Gravity and forward motion keep satellites in space.

questions.question: Which planet has tilted rotation?
questions.answer: Uranus has a highly tilted rotation.

questions.question: Which planet has extreme cold temperatures?
questions.answer: Neptune has extremely low temperatures.

questions.question: What is escape velocity?
questions.answer: It is the speed needed to escape gravity.

questions.question: Why should we protect Earth?
questions.answer: Earth is our only home.

questions.question: Which heavenly body provides light at night?
questions.answer: The Moon provides light at night.

questions.question: Which planet has thick clouds of gas?
questions.answer: Venus has thick clouds of gas.

questions.question: Which planet is a gas giant?
questions.answer: Jupiter is a gas giant.

questions.question: Which planet has the shortest year?
questions.answer: Mercury has the shortest year.

questions.question: Which planet has the longest year?
questions.answer: Neptune has the longest year.

questions.question: Which planet has almost no atmosphere?
questions.answer: Mercury has almost no atmosphere.

questions.question: What causes eclipses?
questions.answer: Eclipses occur due to shadows of heavenly bodies.

questions.question: What is a lunar eclipse?
questions.answer: It occurs when Earth’s shadow falls on the Moon.

questions.question: What is a solar eclipse?
questions.answer: It occurs when the Moon blocks the Sun.

questions.question: Which planet supports liquid water?
questions.answer: Earth supports liquid water.

questions.question: Which planet has many rings and moons?
questions.answer: Saturn has many rings and moons.

questions.question: Why do planets look steady in the sky?
questions.answer: Planets do not twinkle like stars.

questions.question: Which planet has the strongest gravity?
questions.answer: Jupiter has the strongest gravity.

questions.question: What is the Moon’s source of light?
questions.answer: The Moon reflects sunlight.

questions.question: Why is Mercury very hot and very cold?
questions.answer: Mercury lacks an atmosphere to control temperature.

questions.question: Which planet is known for its Great Red Spot?
questions.answer: Jupiter is known for the Great Red Spot.

questions.question: What is thrust?
questions.answer: Thrust is the force that pushes a rocket upward.

questions.question: Why do rockets move upward?
questions.answer: They move upward due to thrust from fuel.

questions.question: Which planet is known as a water planet?
questions.answer: Earth is known as a water planet.

questions.question: Which planet has very strong winds?
questions.answer: Neptune has very strong winds.

questions.question: Which planet has a rocky surface?
questions.answer: Earth has a rocky surface.

questions.question: Why is Earth precious?
questions.answer: Earth is precious because it supports life.

questions.question: What makes Earth different from other planets?
questions.answer: The presence of life makes Earth different.
